Fraser's fascination for the performing arts led him to the prestigious Tisch School of the Arts at New York University, where he earned his Bachelor of Fine Arts in 1991. From there, he embarked on a successful acting career that has spanned over three decades.

His breakthrough role came in 1994 when he appeared in the sports drama film "Georgia," playing the title character, which earned him a Golden Globe nomination for Best Supporting Actor. However, it was in 1997 that Fraser skyrocketed to international fame with the release of the blockbuster action-comedy film "The Mummy." In this role, Fraser portrayed the charming and fearless adventurer Rick O'Connell, and he earned a coveted Golden Globe Award nomination for Best Actor.

Following his success in "The Mummy," Fraser continued to showcase his versatile acting skills in an array of genres. He starred in films like "The Glass House" (1997), "The Bone Collector" (1999), and the beloved "The Rugrats Movie" (1998). His most recognizable roles, however, were in the popular "Lara Croft: Tomb Raider" (2001) and "The Cooler" (2003) trilogies, in which he played the character Jack Trakar.

Fraser's acting prowess extends beyond action-packed films. He demonstrated his range with dramatic performances in movies such as "John Q" (2002), "The Colony" (2008), and "The Life Before Her Eyes" (2007). intro: Brendan Fraser is a prominent American-Canadian actor, known for his roles in comedies and dramas.
